sub_title: Assistant Professor | Organization Theory | Open Science
summary:
Sarita is a person that leads with kindness, patience and intelligence. She lectures in organization theory at the Faculty of Humanities at Leiden University within the Bachelor of Arts programme in International Studies. 

Sarita collaborates with colleagues and project partners across different academic, professional and personal backgrounds and generations. She is a coordinating lecturer of large and small teams of peers.

Her research interests and passions are institutional theory, social-symbolic work perspective, sensemaking, theory-practice gap, university-industry relations, careers and alumni relations. Sarita's preferred scientifc approach involve aspects from phenomenology, pragmatism and embodied research. 

In the last decade at International Studies, Sarita has recruited 40 partner organisations, coached 350+ interns and built a flourishing LinkedIn network (> 4k). of students, alumni and organisations across private, public and voluntary sectors.

Wherever she goes, Sarita aims to connect, motivate and inspire.

profile_positions.description:
I delivered a consultancy pitch and report tailored to the needs of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs on pandemic recovery and the Sustainable Development Goals through group collaboration and coordination with a team of 14. 

Besides carrying out the role of subgroup leader my tasks included researching, qualitative and quantitative data collection and writing to provide this partner organisation with valuable practical recommendations and concrete action points based on solid scientific research. 

Through my consultancy research I specialized in SDG13: Climate Action, and advised for stronger awareness of local knowledge and culture in sustainable practices and inclusion and representation of local leadership in development projects for climate resilience through case studies in Ethiopia and Uganda. As leader, it was also my responsibility to ensure that my subgroup was able to meet deadlines throughout the progress of the report, and to coordinate with the other subgroup leaders. 

During the pandemic, I adapted to remote coordination with my team and coped with unforeseen circumstances on a weekly basis. Through this flexibility, resilience and diligent research within a large team, we succeeded in delivering impactful consultancies to the partner organisation, the Multilateral Organisations and Human Rights Department of the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

In this role I viewed movies, did research, formed thoughts and wrote review in Dutch, occassionally I also visited, interviewed for and photographed movie premieres.

In this role I packwalk four dogs weekly for > 3 km, usually in park areas and provide physical interaction, play, nurturing, and companionship. This depends on the instruction from their owners, their specific needs and individual character. 

For example, when a dog needs to learn to follow their human more, and look to them as a source of guidance, or when a dog needs to learn to spend some time away from their owner. When needed I also ensure other basic need fulfillment such as ingestion of (medicinal) food and hydration with clean, fresh water.

Moreover I dogsit a 2,5 year old and together with my dog work on the decreasing the other dog’s anxiety, socialization, leash training and more indepence from his owner

Overall, I focus on attaining their trust, love and respect through calm and joyful energy and, for them, guidance and confident leadership.
